# Shudi's Data Science Blog

## Overview

This blog showcases a collection of data science projects that demonstrate various techniques in machine learning, natural language processing (NLP), data visualization, and web scraping. The blog is hosted using [Fastpages](https://github.com/fastai/fastpages) to present Jupyter notebooks and technical documentation in a user-friendly format, making it easier for readers to interact with the code and understand the process behind each project.

### Website Link: [Shudi's Data Science Blog](https://shudi-zhao.github.io/My_Data_Science_Blog/)

## Key Projects

### 1. **Training a Computer to Blind Taste Wine (Part II)**  
   - **Published**: May 8, 2021  
   - **Description**: This project is an NLP application using `spaCy` and a Random Forest Classifier to predict wine varieties based on sommelier tasting notes. It explores advanced text classification techniques inspired by a popular Wine Blog.

### 2. **Training a Computer to Blind Taste Wine (Part I)**  
   - **Published**: May 7, 2021  
   - **Description**: This is the first part of a two-part project where I explore wine tasting notes using Natural Language Processing (NLP). The project involves exploratory data analysis (EDA) and feature extraction using `spaCy`.

### 3. **Stock Price Prediction using Python**  
   - **Published**: Mar 17, 2021  
   - **Description**: This project focuses on predicting the stock prices of the most active stocks using Selenium for web scraping, machine learning techniques, and historical stock data. The model uses linear regression for forecasting future stock prices.

### 4. **Sentiment Analysis on Amazon Reviews with Python**  
   - **Published**: Mar 14, 2021  
   - **Description**: This project involves sentiment analysis of Amazon reviews. It demonstrates data cleaning techniques, text-based visualizations using WordCloud and Seaborn, and logistic regression to classify sentiments from customer reviews.

### 5. **Women Shoe Prices Analysis**  
   - **Published**: Dec 1, 2020  
   - **Description**: An exploratory data analysis (EDA) on women's shoe prices, visualizing price distribution and comparing brands. This project focuses on uncovering trends and insights using various visualization techniques.

## Hosting and Tools Used

- **Hosted on**: [Fastpages](https://github.com/fastai/fastpages) â€” a blogging platform for creating data science blogs and showcasing Jupyter notebooks in an interactive way.
- **Jupyter Notebooks**: All projects are presented using Jupyter notebooks, allowing readers to see both the code and results in an organized, readable format.
- **Tools & Technologies**:
  - **Python**: Main programming language for data analysis and machine learning tasks.
  - **Selenium**: Used for web scraping tasks.
  - **spaCy**: Natural Language Processing library used in the wine tasting projects.
  - **Pandas**: For data manipulation and analysis.
  - **Scikit-learn**: Machine learning library for building and evaluating predictive models.
  - **Matplotlib/Seaborn**: For creating visualizations and charts.
  - **WordCloud**: For text-based visualizations.

## How to Explore the Projects

1. **Navigate to the Blog**: Visit [Shudi's Data Science Blog](https://shudi-zhao.github.io/My_Data_Science_Blog/) to browse through the different posts and projects.
2. **Interact with the Code**: Each project is presented in Jupyter notebooks. You can view the code, visualizations, and results directly in the browser.
3. **Learn from Tutorials**: Many posts provide a detailed explanation of the techniques and methods used in the projects, along with links to further reading or resources.

## How to Contribute

If you find any issues with the blog or projects or want to contribute, feel free to reach out or make suggestions via GitHub. You can also fork the repository and create pull requests with your improvements.
